text: Michael Chant is an English composer and political activist. Born in 1945, he became politically active in the 1960s while associated with another composer, Cornelius Cardew. Chant became a member of the Communist Party of England (Marxist-Leninist) and remains active in the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) and is also an active trade unionist. His musical work has continued to focus on political issues, as did his original work with the Scratch Orchestra, an experimental performing ensemble. He is currently living and working in Plymouth, England. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:Anti-revisionists Category:English composers Category:English communists Category:English trade unionists
